title: â€˜God of Warâ€™ Amazon TV Series Sets Frederick E. O. Toye to Direct First Two Episodes, Two Season Order Confirmed
description:
The â€œGod of Warâ€ TV series at Amazon Prime Video has added veteran director Frederick E.O. Toye to its creative team. 

	Variety has confirmed that
body:
The â€œGod of Warâ€ TV series at Amazon Prime Video has added veteran director Frederick E.O. Toye to its creative team. 

	Variety has confirmed that Toye will direct the first two episodes of the epic video game adaptation, which is currently in preproduction. It is also now confirmed that Amazon has ordered two seasons of the series, with casting underway. 

	As previously reported, the series will adapt the story of Kratos beginning with the 2018 â€œGod of Warâ€ game. The showâ€™s official logline states, â€œâ€˜God of Warâ€™ follows father and son Kratos and Atreus as they embark on a journey to spread the ashes of their wife and mother, Faye. Through their adventures, Kratos tries to teach his son to be a better god, while Atreus tries to teach his father how to be a better human.â€ 
	

	Toye is a highly-accomplished TV director, winning the Emmy for outstanding directing for a drama series for FXâ€™s â€œShogunâ€ in 2024. He has also worked on hit shows like â€œWestworld,â€ â€œThe Walking Dead,â€ and â€œWatchmen.â€ Toye is also no stranger to Amazon audiences, having helmed episodes of shows like â€œThe Boys,â€ â€œFalloutâ€ (another video game adaptation), and both â€œThe Terminal Listâ€ and â€œThe Terminal List: Dark Wolf.â€ 


	He is repped by CAA and Sloane Offer. 

	Amazonâ€™s adaptation of â€œGod of Warâ€ has had a long road to the screen already. The show was originally greenlit at the streaming arm of the e-commerce giant back in 2022. Original showrunner Rafe Judkins exited the show in October 2024, with Ronald D. Moore joining as the new showrunner not long after. 

	More to comeâ€¦

schema.headline: â€˜God of Warâ€™ Amazon TV Series Sets Frederick E. O. Toye to Direct First Two Episodes, Two Season Order Confirmed

title: â€˜Sonicâ€™ Spinoff Movie and â€˜Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€™ Live-Action Film Set 2028 Release Dates
description:
New â€œTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€ and â€œSonic the Hedgehogâ€ movies will race to theaters in 2028. 

	Paramount has added an untitled â€œTeenage Mutant
body:
New â€œTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€ and â€œSonic the Hedgehogâ€ movies will race to theaters in 2028. 

	Paramount has added an untitled â€œTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€ film to the calendar on Nov. 17, 2028, as well as an untitled â€œSonic Universe Event Filmâ€ on Dec. 22, 2028. The studio also announced plans to bring â€œTop Gunâ€ back to the big screen on May 13, 2026, in honor of its 40th anniversary.


	Paramount is keeping the details for its â€œTMNTâ€ and â€œSonicâ€ films under wraps. All thatâ€™s confirmed is producer Neal H. Moritz, best known as the brains behind the successful â€œSonic the Hedgehogâ€ trilogy, is also behind the new â€œNinja Turtlesâ€ adventure.
	

	â€œTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€ will be a family friendly live-action/CG animation hybrid take on the turtle brothers known as Leonardo, Donatello, Raphael and Michelangelo. It will be the first live-action â€œTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€ since 2016â€™s theatrical disappointment â€œOut of the Shadows.â€ Paramount since turned to animation with 2023â€™s modestly successful â€œTeenage Mutant Ninja Turtles: Mutant Mayhem,â€ which was written by Seth Rogen and Evan Goldberg. â€œMutant Mayhem 2â€ is set to debut on Sept. 17, 2027.


	The upcoming â€œSonicâ€ entry, based on the Sega video game franchise, is separate from â€œSonic the Hedgehog 4,â€ which is slated for March 19, 2027. â€œSonicâ€ has become a valuable property for Paramount, with the first three installmentsÂ collectively surpassing $1 billion worldwide.

	â€œTop Gun,â€ directed by Tony Scott and starring Tom Cruise, was released in 1986 and became the highest grossing film of that year with $357.4 million. The story follows Lt. Pete â€œMaverickâ€ Mitchell, a hotshot flier who is competing to become the top fighter pilot. Cruise reprised his role for the 2022 sequel, â€œTop Gun: Maverick,â€ which became the biggest film in Paramountâ€™s 113-year history with $1.49 billion.

schema.headline: â€˜Sonicâ€™ Spinoff Movie and â€˜Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtlesâ€™ Live-Action Film Set 2028 Release Dates

title: Paramount+ Sets True-Crime Docuseries â€˜Handsome Devilâ€™ About the â€˜Deadpool Killerâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Paramount+ has greenlit a new true-crime documentary about Wade Wilson aka the â€œDeadpool Killer,â€ who in 2019 was convicted of the murders of Kristi
body:
Paramount+ has greenlit a new true-crime documentary about Wade Wilson aka the â€œDeadpool Killer,â€ who in 2019 was convicted of the murders of Kristine Melton and Diane Ruiz.

	Titled â€œHandsome Devil: Charming Killer,â€ the three-part series is currently in production and will premiere early in 2026. It unravels why the 25-year-old Florida man committed horrific violence â€” and why his mugshot made him a social media fixation, with legions of people becoming fascinated by his face tattoos and disturbing crimes. Wilsonâ€™s trial was televised and picked apart by true-crime obsessives online.
	

	The docuseries uses police bodycam footage and interviews with people close to the case to tell the story of Wilson, who happens to share the name of a popular Marvel superhero.


	Itâ€™s written by Brian Ross, who also serves as producer and director with Rhonda Schwartz for Law & Crime Productions. Dan Abrams, Rachel StockmanÂ and Melody ShafirÂ are executive producers. For See It Now Studios, Susan Zirinsky and Terence Wrong are executive producers, and Aysu Saliba and Cara Tortora are supervising producers.Â 

	â€œâ€˜HandsomeÂ Devilâ€™Â revealsÂ aÂ dangerous obsession and infatuation with a convicted, brutal killer in the digital age,â€ said Zirinsky, president of See It Now.Â â€œThe docuseries explores the intersection between true crime and internet culture,Â with unnerving and shocking accounts from those who professed their love, as well as those who fought forÂ justice.â€

	Ross added, â€œThe more we dug into this story, the crazier it got.â€

	â€œHandsome Devil: Charming Killerâ€ joins Paramount+â€™s slate of true-crime programming. In August, Variety unveiled two of those docuseries: â€œThirst Trap: The Fame. The Fantasy. The Fallout,â€ about a 21-year-old TikToker whose interactions with fans became toxic; and â€œDonâ€™t Date Brandon,â€ about a modern relationship haunted by deception.

schema.headline: Paramount+ Sets True-Crime Docuseries â€˜Handsome Devilâ€™ About the â€˜Deadpool Killerâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: Cannes Winner Jafar Panahi Sentenced to a Year in Prison in Iran in Absentia, Lawyer Says
description: Palme dâ€™Or-winning filmmaker Jafar Panahi has been sentenced in absentia in Iran to one year in prison and a travel ban, according to his lawyer via
body:
Palme dâ€™Or-winning filmmaker Jafar Panahi has been sentenced in absentia in Iran to one year in prison and a travel ban, according to his lawyer via the AFP news agency.

	Panahiâ€™s lawyer, Mostafa Nili, said the sentence includes a two-year travel ban and prohibition of Panahi from membership of any political or social groups. He added that they would file an appeal.

	The charges against the filmmaker were that he had engaged in â€œpropaganda activitiesâ€ against the state, but Nili did not elaborate. 
	

	Panahi was recently in the U.S. to promote his Cannes-winning film â€œIt Was Just an Accident,â€ and is due to attend the Marrakech Film Festival on Thursday, where the film screens. He is a resident of France. The film was selected by France as its submission for the Academy Awards in the international feature film category, and is expected to make the shortlist.


	In â€œIt Was Just an Accidentâ€ five former inmates contemplate whether to exact revenge on a man they believe to be their former jailer.

	The director has had frequent run-ins with the Iranian authorities. 

	In 2010, he was barred from making films and from leaving Iran after supporting anti-government protests and making films critical of the country.

	He was later convicted of â€œpropaganda against the system,â€ and sentenced to six years in jail but served only two months before being released on bail.

	Despite the ban on filmmaking, he shot the documentary â€œThis Is Not a Film,â€ which was released in 2011, and â€œTaxi,â€ in which Panahi acted as a taxi driver, came out in 2015.

	In 2022, he was arrested in connection with protests by a group of filmmakers but was released about seven months later.

schema.headline: Cannes Winner Jafar Panahi Sentenced to a Year in Prison in Iran in Absentia, Lawyer Says

title: CBS Vampire Comedy Pilot From â€˜Ghostsâ€™ Showrunners Casts Ed Weeks in Lead Role
description:
Ed Weeks is set for one of the lead roles in the CBS comedy pilot â€œEternally Yours,â€ Variety has learned. 

	The single-camera show was picked up to
body:
Ed Weeks is set for one of the lead roles in the CBS comedy pilot â€œEternally Yours,â€ Variety has learned. 

	The single-camera show was picked up to pilot at the broadcaster in July, while CBS had originally opened a development room for the show in mid 2024. It hails from Joe Port and Joe Wiseman, who developed the hit CBS comedy series â€œGhosts.â€ 

	The official logline for â€œEternally Yoursâ€ describes the pilot as, â€œAn eternal love story about two vampires who have been married for five hundred years, and their struggles to accept the human who is dating their daughter.â€ 
	

	Weeks will star as Charles, one half of the vampire couple at the center of the series. The character description states, â€œNobility back in the Middle Ages, Charles is now a pencil pusher who, along with his family, has to move every few years to avoid attracting attention to the fact that they never age. Charles disdains modernity and the weak-minded humans who inhabit it, which makes it all the worse when he learns his vampire daughter is now dating one.â€ 

	Weeksâ€™ best known TV role is his portrayal of Dr. Jeremy Reed on the Fox/Hulu comedy series â€œThe Mindy Project,â€ on which he starred throughout the showâ€™s six-season run. He also starred in the Fox sitcom â€œLA to Vegasâ€ and has appeared in shows like â€œHouse of Lies,â€ â€œDirty Sexy Funny,â€ â€œThe IT Crowd,â€ and â€œNot Going Out.â€ He has also been in films such as â€œThe Leisure Class,â€ â€œ3rd Street Blackout,â€ and â€œDrop.â€ 

	He is repped by Curate, WME, and Yorn Levine. 

	â€œEternally Yoursâ€ will film in early 2026. Should it go to series and debut next fall, it would air alongside â€œGhosts,â€ which was renewed through the 2026-2027 broadcast season back in February. 
	

	Port and Wiseman are writers and executive producers on â€œEternally Yours.â€ Eric Tannenbaum, Kim Tannenbaum, and Jason Wang also executive produce. CBS Studios will produce.

schema.headline: CBS Vampire Comedy Pilot From â€˜Ghostsâ€™ Showrunners Casts Ed Weeks in Lead Role

title: Diddy Slams Netflix Documentary as â€˜Shameful Hit Pieceâ€™ With â€˜Stolen Footage That Was Never Authorized for Releaseâ€™: â€˜It Is Unfair and Illegalâ€™
description: A spokesperson for Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combs has has slammed 50 Centâ€™s upcoming Netflix docuseries â€œSean Combs: The Reckoningâ€ as a â€œshameful hit pieceâ€ an
body:
A spokesperson for Sean â€œDiddyâ€ Combs has has slammed 50 Centâ€™s upcoming Netflix docuseries â€œSean Combs: The Reckoningâ€ as a â€œshameful hit pieceâ€ and accused Netflix of using â€œstolen footage that was never authorized for release.â€

	When reached for comment about the allegation of stolen footage, a representative for Netflix directed Variety to a quote from docuseries director Alexandria Stapleton. â€œIt came to us, we obtained the footage legally and have the necessary rights,â€ she said. â€œWe moved heaven and earth to keep the filmmakerâ€™s identity confidential. One thing about Sean Combs is that heâ€™s always filming himself, and itâ€™s been an obsession throughout the decades. We also reached out to Sean Combsâ€™ legal team for an interview and comment multiple times, but did not hear back.â€
	

	Combsâ€™ representative released the statement on Monday, the day before â€œThe Reckoningâ€ premieres, after Netflix released a new teaser for the docuseries. In it, Combs is seen on a phone call six days before his 2024 arrest, which eventually led him to be convicted of transportation to engage in prostitution, though he was acquitted of more serious sex trafficking and racketeering charges. â€œWe need to find someone who will work with us who has worked in the dirtiest of dirty businesses,â€ he says in the footage. â€œWe are losing.â€


	Combsâ€™ rep says that Combs â€œhas been amassing footage since he was 19 to tell his own story, in his own way,â€ but that Netflix is using his words out of context. The statement also name-checks Ted Sarandos multiple times, saying Combs has â€œlong respectedâ€ the Netflix CEO and that he â€œexpected fairness from people he respected.â€ Additionally, the rep wrote that 50 Cent is â€œa longtime adversary with a personal vendetta who has spent too much time slandering Mr. Combsâ€ and that it is â€œstaggering that Netflix handed creative controlâ€ to him.
	

	Read the full statement below. 

	Netflixâ€™s so-called â€˜documentaryâ€™ is a shameful hit piece. Todayâ€™sÂ GMAÂ teaser confirms that Netflix relied on stolen footage that was never authorized for release. As Netflix and CEO Ted Sarandos know, Mr. Combs has been amassing footage since he was 19 to tell his own story, in his own way. It is fundamentally unfair, and illegal, for Netflix to misappropriate that work.

	Netflix is plainly desperate to sensationalize every minute of Mr. Combsâ€™s life, without regard for truth, in order to capitalize on a never-ending media frenzy. If Netflix cared about truth or about Mr. Combsâ€™s legal rights, it would not be ripping private footage out of context â€“ including conversations with his lawyers that were never intended for public viewing. No rights in that material were ever transferred to Netflix or any third party.

	It is equally staggering that Netflix handed creative control to Curtis â€˜50 Centâ€™ Jackson â€“ a longtime adversary with a personal vendetta who has spent too much time slandering Mr. Combs.

	Beyond the legal issues, this is a personal breach of trust. Mr. Combs has long respected Ted Sarandos and admired the legacy of Clarence Avant. For Netflix to give his life story to someone who has publicly attacked him for decades feels like an unnecessary and deeply personal affront. At minimum, he expected fairness from people he respected.

schema.headline: Diddy Slams Netflix Documentary as â€˜Shameful Hit Pieceâ€™ With â€˜Stolen Footage That Was Never Authorized for Releaseâ€™: â€˜It Is Unfair and Illegalâ€™

title: Mexicoâ€™s Tulip Pictures Launching Outposts in Austin and Madrid, and Bows Teaser of Director Lorena Villarrealâ€™s Dark Comedy â€˜Life Isâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)
description: Mexicoâ€™s Tulip Pictures, formerly Barraca Prods., is opening offices in Austin, Texas and Spain as it seeks to tap their respective incentives and f
body:
Mexicoâ€™s Tulip Pictures, formerly Barraca Prods., is opening offices in Austin, Texas and Spain as it seeks to tap their respective incentives and foster new co-productions.

	Both places offer vibrant and infinite possibilities, said Lorena Villarreal, co-owner-founder of Tulip Pictures alongside her husband, Darian de la Fuente. Move comes as more Latin American companies are setting up shop in Madrid, including Chileâ€™s Clara Films and Peruâ€™s Tondero, among others.
	

	Villarrealâ€™s third directorial outing, â€œLife Isâ€ (â€œLa vida esâ€) is also bowing its official international teaser trailer with Variety. The dark comedy had its world premiere at Argentinaâ€™s Mar del Plata Film Festival, the only A-list festival in Latin America, where it was well received by critics and audiences alike.





	â€œExperiencing the film with the audience in the festival was priceless,â€ said Villarreal who was deeply moved by the â€œgreat creative exchanges and level of appreciation for independent cinema in Argentina.â€

	Penned by Villarreal and Ian Martin (â€œVeep,â€ â€œThe Death of Stalinâ€), the pic will be hitting the international festival circuit before it debuts in Mexico next year. It was produced by Villarreal, de la Fuente andÂ Denisse Chapa of Tulip Pictures and Axel Kuschevatzky of Infinity Hill along with Barraca Prods. in its last foray into filmmaking before it focuses solely on advertising production

	Starring Chileâ€™s Paulina Garcia (â€œGloriaâ€), Naian GonzÃ¡lez Norvind (â€œCorinaâ€), Natalia Plascencia (â€œFamiliaâ€) and RubÃ©n Ochandiano (â€œBiutifulâ€), it focuses on two women about to turn 40 who face mid-life predicaments as they navigate a mosaic of emotions and multiple events.
	

	Noraâ€™s (Plasencia) existential crisis is triggered by multiple collapses her family life, emotional stability, career and fracturing polyamorous relationship while Ely (GonzÃ¡lez Norvind) longs for some stability in her life.

	Said Villarreal: â€œDirecting â€˜Life Isâ€™ gave me the opportunity to explore themes such as loss, midlife crisis and the search for oneâ€™s purpose and identity â€“ what we truly want in life and who we truly are â€“ through a distinctly female perspective and within a diverse narrative universe.â€

	â€œLife Isâ€ marks quite a departure from Villarrealâ€™s previous pics â€œThe Weeping Womenâ€ (â€œLas Lloronasâ€) and â€œSilencio,â€ which are both genre pics, although Villarreal sees some resemblance to â€œLas Lloronasâ€ as they are both about women.

	Tulip Pictures kicks off the international rollout of â€œLife Isâ€ at Ventana Sur as it moves to expand its offices and bolster its status across the Ibero-American, U.S. and international markets.

	Its latest acquisitions include Ratchapoom Boonbunchachokeâ€™s â€œA Useful Ghost,â€ winner of Cannesâ€™ Criticsâ€™ Week; Diego CÃ©spedesâ€™ Un Certain Regard winner â€œThe Mysterious Gaze of the Flamingo,â€ also Chileâ€™s Oscar submission, and Eva Libertadâ€™s â€œDeafâ€ (â€œSordaâ€), winner of Berlinaleâ€™s Panorama Audience Award and multiple Malaga Festival prizes.

	Tulipâ€™s broader slate includes work by Hirokazu Kore-eda, Paul Verhoeven and Andrea Arnold, along with emerging filmmakers on the international circuit.

	Meanwhile, Villarreal is preparing her English-language feature â€œOphelia,â€ co-written again with Martin, an Emmy winner and BAFTA nominee, which centers on a 60-year-old woman facing a pivotal moment of reckoning. Target shooting locations are either in Spain or the U.K. by September next year.

	Tulip will also host the second edition of its Muestra de Oaxaca, a showcase of Mexican cinema, next spring, and will again be organizing the Monterrey International Film Festival, also slated for 2026.

	As part of the companyâ€™s structure, Abraham GonzÃ¡lez Ruiz leads the distribution arm of Tulip Pictures as director of distribution and acquisitions while Paloma Cabrera serves as director of production and development, overseeing Tulipâ€™s project pipeline and cross-border collaborations.



	

					Natalia Plasencia, Lorena Villarreal, Naian GonzÃ¡lez (l-r) Credit: Cleo Bouza

schema.headline: Mexicoâ€™s Tulip Pictures Launching Outposts in Austin and Madrid, and Bows Teaser of Director Lorena Villarrealâ€™s Dark Comedy â€˜Life Isâ€™ (EXCLUSIVE)

title: The Best Grateful Dead Merch to Gift the Deadhead in Your Life
description:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	The Deadh
body:
If you purchase an independently reviewed product or service through a link on our website, Variety may receive an affiliate commission.

	The Deadhead fandom lives on, if not in an intergenerational obsession with the iconic rock band than in ongoing collaborations and products that celebrate their legacy.

	The best Grateful Dead merch includes a bestselling book of annotated lyrics, a â€œThe Music Never Stoppedâ€ vinyl box set and Dancing Bear-themed apron from Hedley & Bennett.

	Below, check out some of the best Grateful Dead merch to gift the Deadheads in your life this year â€” just in time for the holidays.


		

						
			
	

	
					
		

										BESTSELLER						

					The Complete Annotated Grateful Dead Lyrics		

	
		For the Deadhead who treats liner notes like scripture, The Complete Annotated Grateful Dead Lyrics is the definitive text. Edited by David Dodd, the book gathers every officially released lyric and pairs it with rich annotations that unpack the bandâ€™s folk, blues and beat-poet influences. Itâ€™s a deep-dive companion for anyone looking to decode the mythology behind â€œRipple,â€ â€œDark Star,â€ and the rest of the Deadâ€™s sprawling, psychedelic canon.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					The Music Never Stopped (Live) LP Box Set		

	
		One of the best Grateful Dead live albums, â€œThe Music Never Stoppedâ€ contains songs recorded in concert over 25 years (from 1969-1994), packaged in this six-record vinyl box set.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Hedley Bennett x Grateful Dead Apron		

	
		Dancing bears carry whisks and pans in Hedley & Bennettâ€™s recent collaboration with the Grateful Dead, which is made up of two funky aprons inspired by the bandâ€™s psychedelic imagery. The louder option of the two features blue and purple tie dye, in addition to dancing bears holding culinary tools such as cutting knives and whisks. Both aprons are made out of 90% Cotton, 8% Polyester, 2% Spandex. Plus, you can personalize the gift by adding custom embroidered letters on the right chest for an additional $15.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Here Beside the Rising Tide: Jerry Garcia, the Grateful Dead, and an American Awakening		

	
		This sweeping 528-page chronicle by Jim Newton traces Garciaâ€™s journey from a raw folkâ€“bluegrass musician to the face of a generation, while mapping the bandâ€™s odyssey across festivals, political flashpoints and cultural revolutions.	
		
	

		

						
			
	

	
					
		

					Dancing Bears x Slowtide Fleece Blanket		

	
		Slowtide partnered with Grateful Dead drummer Mickey Hart for this summer capsule collection last year. The lineup consists of three quick-dry towels, donning  psychedelic graphics originally created on canvas with acrylic paint byÂ Hart. â€œSlowtide towels offer a state of the art design that are both sand and water resistant. Paired with my images, these towels offer a unique take on what a beach towel of the future is,â€ Hart said in a statement.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Jammer Quick-Dry Kitchen Towel		

	
		Started by three friends, Slowtide creates comfort for outdoor hangouts. The brands whole vibe is basically creating various blankets and towels to keep your beach hangs both comfortable and stylish. Youâ€™ll spot their towels at trendy places including the Los Angeles, Portland and Palm Springs Ace Hotels. However, itâ€™s their recent Grateful Dead collaboration that keeps selling out. This line includes over 12 different Grateful Dead-inspired blankets, towels and robes. Brighten up your kitchen with this adorable quick-drying towel, decorated with the bandâ€™s iconic Steal Your Face logo. 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Shashibo Shapeshifting Box		

	
		This Grateful Dead fidget toy is a magnetic puzzle cube that can be transformed into 70 unique shapes. But aside from serving as a relaxing way to keep your hands busy throughout the day, it also doubles as a charming decor piece to add to your office or living room. For the partnership with the iconic band, the cube is upgraded with famous Grateful Dead imagery such as colorful dancing bears and the famous â€œSteal Your Faceâ€ album art.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Grateful Dead x Chinatown Market Classic Crocs		

	
		The Grateful Dead gets the Croc treatment with this limited-edition tie-dye release currently available on StockX. 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Grateful Dead x Pact Graphic Tee		

	
		A subtle tie-dye look for the fan who doesnâ€™t need all eyes on them. The â€œWharf Ratâ€ tee is made of GOTS certified organic cotton and comes in all sizes from small to extra-large.Â 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Lucky Brand Grateful Dead Bears Tee		

	
		Christmas-themed Grateful Bead Bears march across this festive tee from Lucky Brand.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Jerry Garcia Funko Pop		

	
		Jerry Garcia is the definition of cool even in Funko Pop form, which sees the famous rocker in his classic aviator sunnies and electric guitar.Â 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Steal Your Face Backpack		

	
		This special day backpack will make the perfect companion for everything from the hiking trail to the beach to an outdoor concert. Tagged with the legendary â€œSteal Your Faceâ€ album artwork, the limited edition backpack also features MaxCold insulation, padded straps, two divided compartments to keep items organized and even a built-in bottle opener.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Grateful Dead Tie-Dye Playing Cards		

	
		These make the best addition to any camping trip or long car ride. The full pack comes with different funky images, all featuring the bandâ€™s classic skull imagery and tie-dye patterns.	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Dancing Bears Guitar Strap		

	
		If dadâ€™s a true deadhead, itâ€™s time for them to represent on their guitar while they slowly pick through the opening of â€œUncle Johnâ€™s Band.â€ If youâ€™re looking for something a little less dancing bear, we love this Steal Your Face strap with the bands name printed across. And while youâ€™re at it, pick up a few guitar picks as well.Â 	
		
	

		

			
			
			
			
	

	
					
		

					Grateful Dead Stickers		

	
		Letâ€™s not even pretend for a second that youâ€™re not into stickers. If youâ€™ve made it this far in the â€œBest Grateful Dead Merchandiseâ€ list, you definitely have a steal your face sticker on something or another in your life. Whatâ€™s a few more?

schema.headline: The Best Grateful Dead Merch to Gift the Deadhead in Your Life

title: Megan Thee Stallion Wins Defamation Suit Against Blogger
description:
Megan Thee Stallion has won her defamation lawsuit against blogger Milagro Cooper, also known as Milagro Gramz.

	A Florida jury on Monday backed th
body:
Megan Thee Stallion has won her defamation lawsuit against blogger Milagro Cooper, also known as Milagro Gramz.

	A Florida jury on Monday backed the rapperâ€™s claims that Cooper had harassed and defamed her after singer Tory Lanez shot her in July 2020. According to NBC News, Megan was awarded $75,000 before U.S. District Court Judge Cecilia M. Altonaga reduced it to $59,000.

	Megan initially sued Cooper in October 2024, claiming that she had conspired with Lanez to defame her after Lanez was sentenced to 10 years in prison on three felony charges. Megan accused Cooper of being a â€œpaid surrogateâ€ and â€œmouthpieceâ€ for Lanez following her testimony against the singer.
	

	She also alleged that Cooper promoted a sexually explicit deepfake of Megan on social media by encouraging her followers to view it. â€œI feel like â€¦ to this day, I feel a little, like, defeated,â€ Megan testified, according to NBC News. â€œBecause no matter what, no matter if the video was fake or not â€¦ [Gramz] wanted it to be real.â€

	Megan stated that Cooperâ€™s actions harmed her mental health. â€œItâ€™s really embarrassing to have to look at what the people donâ€™t know,â€ she said. â€œSee, in a position like that, like, I know itâ€™s not me, but to be in front of everybody else and they have to watch it â€” itâ€™s really embarrassing.â€

	Earlier this year, Megan was granted a five-year restraining order against Lanez. She claimed that he had been harassing her from behind bars as he serves his sentence, and that she testified via video call that she was fearful of what would happen to her after Lanezâ€™s release. â€œI feel like maybe heâ€™ll shoot me again, and maybe this time I wonâ€™t make it,â€ she said.

schema.headline: Megan Thee Stallion Wins Defamation Suit Against Blogger

title: Best Horror of December 2025: The End of â€˜Stranger Things,â€™ Paul Rudd and Jack Black Reboot â€˜Anaconda,â€™ a Killer Santa and More
description: â€œMan Finds Tapeâ€ (Opening in theaters on Dec. 5 via Magnolia Pictures & Magnet Releasing) â€” Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead are producers on this t
body: â€œMan Finds Tapeâ€ (Opening in theaters on Dec. 5 via Magnolia Pictures & Magnet Releasing) â€” Justin Benson and Aaron Moorhead are producers on this twisty indie that finds horror in mysterious found footage tapes. First-time directors Paul Gandersman and Peter Hall conjure impressive imagery and solid scares in this story of siblings investigating a murder and stumbling upon even darker small-town secrets.Â â€œSilent Night, Deadly Nightâ€ (Opening in theaters on Dec. 12 via Cineverse) â€” This remake of the classic holiday slasher features â€œHalloween Endsâ€ star Rohan Campbell as the murderous Santa, and is written and directed by Mike P. Nelson, who helmed the excellent 2021 â€œWrong Turnâ€ reboot. Given the â€˜80s fun of the original film, the property seems ripe for a more nerve-shredding take.Â â€œDust Bunnyâ€ (Opening in theaters on Dec. 12 via Lionsgate) â€” Bryan Fullerâ€™s first foray into writing and directing a film is this stylish horror adventure, where a little girl (Sophie Sloan) hires a hitman (Mads Mikkelsen) to kill the very-real monster living under her bed. Thereâ€™s some great humor and heart in this genre blend from the â€œHannibalâ€ and â€œPushing Daisiesâ€ mastermind.Â â€œThe Plagueâ€ (Opening in theaters Dec. 24 via Independent Film Company) â€” Writer and director Charlie Polingerâ€™s body horror film â€” about boys creating their own dark social system at water polo camp â€” debuted in the Un Certain Regard section of this yearâ€™s Cannes Film Festival. Joel Edgerton plays the coach alongside a crew of talented young actors.

schema.headline: Best Horror of December 2025: The End of â€˜Stranger Things,â€™ Paul Rudd and Jack Black Reboot â€˜Anaconda,â€™ a Killer Santa and More

title: TMZ Streaming Live, Come Into Our Newsroom and Watch Things Happen!
description:
TMZ Live Stream
                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!
body:
TMZ Live Stream
                          Come Into Our Office and Watch News Happen!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 1, 2025 9:46 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          We want you to be a part of TMZ, so every weekday, between 9:30 AM and 11:30 AM PT, we take you inside our newsroom via live stream.
      
    
          You never know what you're gonna get ... a big story that breaks, an argument erupts in the room, or someone's just joking around.
      
    
          Your comments are a big part of the stream, and the staff spends a lot of time speaking directly to you. Every day is different!
      
    
          We also use our live stream to produce our "TMZ Live" TV show.

title: Pete Hegseth Turns Franklin the Turtle Into Killing Machine in X Post
description:
Pete Hegseth
                          Full Metal Franklin
                          ... Secretar
body:
Pete Hegseth
                          Full Metal Franklin
                          ... Secretary Turns Cartoon Character Into a Killer
                      
                  
                        Published December 1, 2025 8:55 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Watch out! The Department of War's latest target is all of our childhoods ... Pete Hegseth turned beloved children's book character Franklin the Turtle into a bloodthirsty killing machine in an A.I.-generated pic posted Sunday.
      
    
          Pete captioned the post, "For your Christmas wish list..." along with a fake book cover titled, "Franklin Targets Narco Terrorists."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                                  
      
    
          The bogus cover depicts the 6-year-old turtle from the animated series going "Full Metal Jacket" -- hanging out of a helicopter, happily firing a missile at a manned boat while wearing a U.S. military vest. No sign of Franklin's best friend, Bear ... maybe he's storming the Capitol.
      

          Pete -- reportedly a 45-year-old man, though you couldn't tell from his X account -- made the post following a report he ordered operatives to "kill everybody" on a Venezuelan boat, which was allegedly carrying drugs in the Caribbean on September 2.
      
    
      
      For your Christmas wish listâ€¦ pic.twitter.com/pLXzg20SaLâ€” Pete Hegseth (@PeteHegseth) December 1, 2025
              @PeteHegseth
          
  
    
          According to The Washington Post, the boat was struck twice to comply with Pete's alleged order.
      
    
          Former military lawyer Todd Huntley told the publication killing any of the men in the boats "amounts to murder" because we are not in a legitimate war with them ... and that if the alleged traffickers weren't able to fight, killing them may be considered "a war crime."
      
    
          But at least Pete is reading! So, there's that ...

title: Hulk Hogan's Widow Denies Ric Flair's Claim 'Street Drugs' Killed WWE Legend
description:
Hulk Hogan
                          Widow Denies Ric Flair's Claim
                          ...
body:
Hulk Hogan
                          Widow Denies Ric Flair's Claim
                          ... 'Street Drugs' Didn't Kill WWE Legend!!!
                      
                  
                        Published December 1, 2025 11:58 AM PST
                                                                            
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Ric Flair's shocking claim that "street drugs" killed Hulk Hogan is simply not true ... this, according to the wrestling legend's widow, who tells TMZ Sports the Nature Boy was fed some bad info.
      
    
          Flair recently addressed Hogan's death on the "DOUBL3 COVERAGE" podcast ... when he stated he spoke with Hulk the day before he passed about his deteriorating health.
      
    
          Flair claimed Hogan's doctor stopped prescribing him pain medication to combat his numerous wrestling injuries ... so he resorted to unorthodox measures to deal with his suffering.
      

          We asked Hogan's widow, Sky, about Flair's comments ... and she said point-blank, "That didn't happen at all."
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          Sky -- who also denied Flair spoke to Hulk the day before his death -- went on to say the icon was under constant care of the Morton Plant Hospital in Florida ... so Naitch had to have been either misinformed or misunderstood.
      
    
          Sky said the only changes to Hogan's medication came following his neck procedure to ensure whatever he was taking did not impact his lungs.
      
    
          We spoke with two other family sources about Flair's claim ... and they both stated it was completely untrue as well.
      
    
          The family isn't pissed at Flair -- they know he was one of Hogan's close buddies and didn't mean any harm with his words ... but wanted to make it clear he got this one wrong.
      
    
                  
          
                          
                
                  
      
    
          TMZ Sports broke the story -- Hulk Hogan died at 71 years old on July 24. His official cause of death was listed as a heart attack, according to records from the Pinellas County Forensic Science Center.
      
    
          As we previously reported, Sky was "planning" to file a malpractice lawsuit over Hogan's death back in August ... although it's unclear if that's still in the works.
      
      
              
          
                          
                Ric Flair
              
                          
                Hulk Hogan
              
                          
                TMZ Sports
              
                          
                Exclusive
              
                          
                Fairly Legal
              
                          
                WWE

schema.headline: Hulk Hogan's Widow Denies Ric Flair's Claim 'Street Drugs' Killed WWE Legend
